pyntacle.misc.kp_runner module¶

class KeyPlayerWrapper(graph: igraph.Graph)[source]¶

Bases: object

Wrapper for the KeyPlayer class, in order to pass proper data structures to the reporter class

get_results()[source]¶
Returns:self.results, a dictionary of key player results
logger = None¶

check if graph has node names and they are unique

run_greedy(key_player, kpsize: int, m=None)[source]¶

Run Greedy optimization and wraps everything into a dictionary that will be passed to pyntacle commands

Parameters:
  • key_player – a single KeyplayerAttribute or a list of KeyPlayerAttributes
  • kpsize – an integer of kpsizes
  • m – the m-reach distance(required if KeyPlayerattribute.MREACH is present
Returns:

a dictionary of results like {keyplayer: ([kpset], [kpvalue])} (this is to remain coherent to the BruteForce optimization
run_pos_or_neg(choice: str, names_list=None, recalculate=False, m=None)[source]¶

Computes kpp-neg (DF, F) and kpp-pos(dR, MREACH) metrics,store everything into a dictionary

Parameters:
  • choice – either “kpp pos” or “kpp neg”
  • names_list – a list of node names
  • recalculate – a boolean that will be passed to the KeyPlayerClass
  • m – if kpp-pos is specified, must be specified
run_single_metrics(key_player: algorithms.key_player._KeyplayerAttribute, names_list=None, recalculate=False, m=None)[source]¶

Given a single metric, compute it and store it into a dictionary of results

Parameters:
  • key_player – a KeyplayerAttribute object
  • names_list – a list of node names
  • recalculate – boolean, whether to pass the “recalculate” flag to the KeyPlayer Method
  • m – if MREACH is specified, this must be specified as well
